sourceMeaningMnemonic: You see a <radical>gate</radical> with a <radical>tree</radical> growing through it and it reminds you that you need more <kanji>leisure</kanji> time. You walk up to the gate tree and curl up under its branches. No one will bother you because the tree is blocking the gate from being used.
meaningInfo: Imagine spending your leisure time curled up under a tree that's growing through a gate. It's so cozy and secluded!
readingMnemonic: As you <kanji>leisure</kanji>ly nap, you hear a gruff voice, "Ah, you're done too, huh?" It's Genghis <reading>Khan</reading> (<ja>かん</ja>)! He's spending his leisure time relaxing under this abandoned gate just like you.
readingInfo: But wait. Isn't Genghis Khan dead now? He winks at you, "Leisure time is for the dead." He smiles, and fades away, disappearing into the tree.
